title: Exploring 4DSTEM-in-SEM: From Implementation to Material Characterization
content: Four-dimensional scanning transmission electron microscopy (4DSTEM) is a powerful diffraction-based technique to investigate electron-transparent samples, probing local crystallinity, orientation, strain, and many more properties [1]. Furthermore, various open source Python packages exist to analyze 4D-STEM datasets, for instance LiberTEM, py4DSTEM, and pyxem [2-4].
